transportAdvice: Ajaccio has a local bus network that connects the city centre with beaches and key tourist areas, though services can be infrequent outside peak season. The historic centre and waterfront are very walkable, and taxis are generally available, though renting a car is advisable for exploring the wider island.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally wet with mild Mediterranean winters, quiet and uncrowded.
Still cool with some rain, but days can be pleasantly mild and sunny between showers.
Spring begins to arrive with warming temperatures and a mix of sun and occasional rain.
Pleasant and increasingly sunny, ideal for sightseeing with comfortable temperatures.
Warm and largely sunny, beaches begin to come alive and the island is at its greenest.
Hot and sunny with very little rain, excellent conditions for beach and outdoor activities.
Peak summer heat with long sunny days, very dry and ideal for swimming and water sports.
Equally hot and dry as July, the busiest tourist month with crowded beaches and resorts.
Warm and still very pleasant with fewer crowds, one of the best months to visit.
Autumn brings cooler temperatures and increasing rainfall, but still comfortable for sightseeing.
Noticeably cooler and wetter, the island quietens significantly as the tourist season ends.
Cool winter conditions with moderate rainfall, peaceful and uncrowded with a local atmosphere.
